As a member of the Marketing team, you will manage all our business and consumer data and transform them into actionable insights and recommendations for the company. You will provide visibility to shoppers’ behaviors both online and offline, market trends and sales performances of our products across our local and overseas markets and platforms. The scope of work involves data mining, data analytics and interactions with cross functional teams and stakeholders from E-commerce, Retail, CRM and Customer Support.

This role is highly multi-functional providing insights and analytical support to drive our Omnichannel transformation to create a seamless consumer experience across all distribution channels thereby connecting online and offline channels as well as elevating the in-store digital consumer experience. The right person should be someone who can do more than organize the data but leverage on data to influence budgeting and strategic decisions. This role will report to the Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities

· Perform all analytical and reporting related activities on Omnichannel transformation, digital performance, e-commerce platforms, customer database, website behavior, campaigns, CRM, loyalty, retail operations (store efficiencies, product/inventory assortment analysis).

· Lead part of business case analysis to support investment decision for projects and initiatives: Identify and formalize data sources, hypotheses, analysis concepts and financial modelling.

· Facilitate business review discussions to gain insights on Omnichannel KPIs, new service concepts, usage and success of innovative digital solutions against budget and forecast.

· Develop dashboards to gain real time insights, provide data visualization, to allow quick access to view and monitor operational and metric performances.

· Utilize CRM reporting tools to monitor consumer buying trends, monitor progressions and loyalty performances.

· Work on projects and reporting across channels to further shape the Omnichannel Reporting capabilities and landscape to drive the companies shift towards an Omnichannel experience.

· Provide any and all ad hoc marketing analytical requests to assess performance of key marketing tactics / strategies.

· Present and deliver weekly / monthly / ad-hoc reports to management and key stakeholders.

Requirements

· Preferably with 2-5 years' experience within a Data Analyst role, ideally with experience in E-commerce and/or Retail and/or Omnichannel or within an end consumer focused, fast changing, new technology driven environment.

· Familiar with Adobe, Google analytics or any other web analytics tool.

· Working knowledge of SQL, Macros, and SSRS for report writing and data management with solid experience working with popular analytics and BI software tools.

· Passion for the retail industry and the application of analytics to drive and enhance the omnichannel experience.

· Strong understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness.

· Ability to transform data effectively into meaningful information to support continued improvements, innovations and growth.

· Proven track record as a resourceful self-starter who is creative and comfortable working cross-functionally.

· Clear communicator who can explain and understand complex problems while dealing with both non-technical and highly-technical teams.

· Ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision

· Intellectual curiosity coupled with exceptional attention to detail

Roles & Responsibilities

Overview of job

Xaxis is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us.

In this role, you will manage media advertising metadata from different sources. Know how to organize it and build regular reports for client. Provide solutions to client’s business according reliable data analysis. Help driving the science behind predicting and pricing the performance of the recommended media solution developed to deliver on the client’s business goals and marketing objectives. You will be an advisor to all internal teams when estimating & forecasting the value we can guarantee our clients will get in return from their media investment. You will drive the data-driven prediction of the variables and parts within the media solution (format, screen, audience, publisher, media quality) that impact the media solution’s overall contribution to the business goal as committed to the client.

You will conduct extensive and complex analyses to inform strategic decision making, and will define outcome and monetization strategies for our media plans, customized client solutions. You will also optimize product pricing to ensure accuracy and successful execution.

Reporting of the role:
You will report to the Director - Marketing Science APAC.

3 best things about the job:
Holistic exposure and learning of programmatic: an ever-evolving and exciting industry, the role will be working across different departments, teams and clients.
International exposure: Opportunity to work with 15 different markets across Asia Pacific, and the global teams in New York, London and LATAM.
Xaxis focuses on providing leading technology enabled media solutions. You’ll be working on the latest that WPP/GroupM has to offer in digital media technology.

Responsibilities of the role:
Provide the newest advertising data to clients and planning teams regularly across the Asia Pacific region. You will play the role of pricing expert for go-to-market teams and devise pricing strategies for custom solutions / strategic deals. You will be driving the approach to achieving pricing rigour and science in our solutions and products.

The data sources you will be utilizing are:
Fast-moving feeds and slow-moving data, research on customer needs, historical data, Political-Economic-Social-Technological market conditions and internal business intelligence tools.

Your main stakeholders in the company:
Client Strategy, Outcome Media Specialists, Client Engagement and Product teams in the Regional Team based in Singapore

Tasks and Scope of Work:
Analyze Pricing Data
Assess data from a variety of sources and use it to derive insights into pricing strategies and market trends. Use quantitative and qualitative methods to analyze and set pricing of various products and solutions
Develop Forecasts and Models
Use a variety of statistical modeling methods to show the potential impact of various pricing strategies, including their effect on outcomes like Cost-Per-Desired Action.
Determine Pricing and Marketing Strategies
Work closely with relevant stakeholders to develop pricing strategies for media solutions.
Conduct hypothesis-driven analyses to identify and quantify pricing opportunities
Monitor Industry Trends
Maintain knowledge and stay abreast of developments in the industry via information obtained from financial publications and services, government agencies, company sources, and personal interviews. Keep a look out for trends that may have the potential to impact our pricing strategies.
Develop Pricing Tools
Take initiative to develop pricing tools that can be used by our teams to quickly respond to request for proposals. As well as tools that streamline the analysis process and provide more immediate information about inventory and supply prices.
Present Findings to Key Decision-Makers
Present your analysis and findings to stakeholders in relevant forums through weekly or monthly meetings. Translate complex data into actionable strategies and techniques to drive sales and enhance marketing efforts.

What you will need:
Bachelor’s degree in finance, operations, research, statistics, math, economics, or related analytical discipline preferred
Yield management experience with planning, forecasting, and business analysis
Experience within one of these industries - Media, Advertising, AdTech
Work cross-functionally throughout the organization to drive analysis-driven change
Demonstrated complex problem resolution proficiency
Proficiency with analytical and presentation tools {Statistical packages, Excel pivot tables, SQL queries, graphing, PowerPoint}
In-depth knowledge of BI tools (Tableau, Cognos, Business Objects or SPSS)
Practical experience analyzing data, programme metrics and performance

Essential skills:
Analytical thinking – to be able to successfully examine and assess data from a variety of sources
Mathematics – excellent mathematical skills to derive insights from multiple data sources and utilize them to develop models and provide pricing advice to decision-makers
Team collaboration – to work closely with teams and markets
Problem-solving skills – effective problem-solving skills is vital in this role
Communication skills – It is vital to be strong in written and verbal communicators, since you will need to present your findings through reports and presentation

More about Xaxis

Xaxis is The Outcome Media Company. It combines advanced artificial intelligence with proprietary data and proven expertise to optimize programmatic media investments and achieve improved, verifiable results for its clients. Xaxis offers managed programmatic services in 47 markets including North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa. For more information, visit www.xaxis.com

About Singapore

GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners.

As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in.

GroupM APAC is committed to fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our people are our strength so we respect and nurture their individual talent and potential.

Job Title: Senior FICC Data Consultant - Global Data
Job Description:
Bloomberg runs on data, and in the Global Data team we're responsible for acquiring it and providing it to our clients. We collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes - and all this while providing platinum customer support to our clients.

The Global Data department in Singapore is looking for a highly motivated and entrepreneurial Senior Data Consultant to look after the areas of Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities (FICC).

This is an exciting opportunity for an ambitious high-performer to take on increased responsibility and to help take our business to the next level.

The Role:


You are the subject-matter-expert in FICC products covered by Global Data and is trusted to consult on the domain internally and externally. You are an experienced professional with solid experience and extensive network of contacts across the financial community. As a result, you help secure unique, non-public content for Bloomberg and discover opportunities for new and existing products. Finally, you act as leaders in the organization by training and mentoring others and can be counted on to perform a wide variety of responsibilities from building relationships to leading projects and analyzing data. You have strong working relationships with other data teams and departments such as Engineering and utilize this network to achieve results.

We'll trust you to:
Function as a subject-matter-expert internally and externally by consulting others on the FICC domains
Influence and build future data products by leveraging your domain expertise
Support Sales and represent Bloomberg by visiting clients and/or engaging in industry events to promote our data products
Build industry relationships to source content that is not publically available
Manage dataset quality by understanding criticality and expectations of dataset in the market
Utilize subject-matter-expertise to set and maintain methodologies for data management
Train and mentor Data Specialists and Data Analysts
Provide customer support for users of Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service, News, Enterprise Solutions, and Bloomberg Law
You'll need to have:


At least eight to twelve years of relevant work experience
Demonstrated domain expertise in FICC data products
Intimate understanding of how industry players utilize data to drive business decisions
An existing network with industry participants
Proven ability to innovate data products and processes
Outstanding communication, interpersonal and client-facing skills
Comfortable fostering C-Level relationships
Demonstrated project management skills, CAPM, PMP and/or CSM preferred
Strong negotiation skills with a consultative approach, and an ability to influence stakeholders
Experience training and mentoring others
We'd love to see:


Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation
A master's degree (preferably in Finance, Economics or Information Systems)
Openness to change and willingness to work through challenges
If this sounds like you:


Apply! If we believe you're a good match, we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.

Disney+ Hotstar is leading the way as the largest and smartest video platform in the country, reaching over 300 million users today. Disney+ Hotstar today is the one-stop destination for all your entertainment needs - from Live Sports, Indian and International Shows and Movies to all Disney content, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Disney+ Originals. We’re looking for the brightest minds to build the future of TV with us.

We are looking for smart and data-driven analysts to join our product team and help drive the growth and success of the product. The individual will need to have deep technical skills to complement their analytical experience The ideal candidate will be scrappy, independent, action-oriented and excited about building data insights to influence product priorities.

The pace of our growth is incredible – if you want to tackle hard and interesting problems at scale, and create an impact within an entrepreneurial environment, join us!

Your Key Responsibilities

Use data to inform and influence the direction of the product team roadmaps to inform business decisions
Partner with product teams to define goals and identify key metrics for existing features and new releases
Build automated dashboards and reports to drive awareness and understanding of key metrics and experiment results

What to Bring

Bachelor’s or Master’s in computer science or related discipline
A proven track record of using data to impact key business or product decisions
The ability to clearly and effectively communicate the results of complex analyses
Minimum of 3 years experience writing production datasets in SQL/Hive OR building internal/production data tools for ETL, experimentation, OR exploration in a scripting language (Python, PHP, Ruby, etc.)
A solid grasp of common statistical applications and methods
High adaptability in a dynamic start-up environment.

Our Values

Audacity
Self-Awareness
Ownership
Bias for Action
Collaboration
Radical Candour
Inclusivity
Mentorship

Who we are as an employer

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

Who we are as a company

We’re Disney+ Hotstar. The go-to destination for over 300 million users for everything from Live Sports, Indian and International Shows and Movies to all Disney content, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Disney+ originals. Our mission is to revolutionize internet entertainment through smart personalization, and by building a global video platform that takes over the world wide web and the whole wide world.

Job Description
Team introduction

We are looking for a data scientist (logistics) to tackle some of South-East Asia's most complex logistical challenges. Think of systems that can schedule millions of orders per day for delivery, estimate lead and arrival times of customer orders, indicate where items should be placed in our warehouses for efficient utilisation of time and space, do path planning for our pickers in warehouses that pick tens of thousands of items per day, etc. Together, with a team of talented individuals, you will work to conceptualise, develop and productionalise intelligent systems aimed at increasing the efficiency of our logistics. The work is done closely with the business where we consult and work out the implementation to improve relevant business metrics.

Job description

You will work in a vertically integrated team of engineers, analysts, data scientists and product managers. You are expected to formulate clear problem definitions, work on proof of concepts to demonstrate the feasibility of new projects and also help carry this into production. Sound fundamentals on basic data science concepts as regression, classification and clustering problems is to be expected. Knowledge and experience in applying operations research techniques is highly preferred. We’re looking for a candidate who is proactive, challenges the status quo and has a strong drive to improve some of the region’s most difficult logistical problems.

Job requirements

Solid programming skills in at least one language (preferably Python)

Good working knowledge of SQL

Experience in data analysis and machine learning libraries (pandas, numpy, seaborn, ggplot, sk-learn, TensorFlow etc.)

Given that we do optimization problems in Java, candidates must have an inclination towards taking up Java in day to day activities

Preferred skills

Knowledge of networking problems

Knowledge of JVM languages (Scala, Kotlin, Java)

Experience in applying operations research techniques in academic or business context

Knowledge of operations research libraries (CPLEX, Gurobi, Optaplanner, etc.)

As you will be working in the logistics domain any domain expertise in transport, warehousing or aviation is highly valued

Exposure to cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, etc.

ABOUT US

Build the Smarter Way to Shop!

ShopBack, the #1 rewards and discovery platform in Asia-Pacific, enables shoppers across the region to shop ‘The Smarter Way”. It is a one-stop rewards and discovery platform for users to earn cashback, while delivering performance-based marketing to merchants. First launched in Singapore in 2014, ShopBack has since expanded its reach to Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand, Taiwan, Australia, and more recently, Vietnam and Korea. In Singapore, the company has also extended its service offering with ShopBack GO, an app-based rewards platform for in-store shopping, dining, and entertainment. We are a passionate team that wants to drive innovation and build a product that we love and are all proud of!

ShopBack partners with over 3,000 merchants including Taobao, Expedia, Shopee, ZALORA to reward its users with cashback across a wide range of categories including general merchandise, travel bookings, fashion, health and beauty, groceries, and food delivery. To date, US$100m in cashback has been awarded to our over 20 million users.

We have global ambitions and are up against international incumbents in a rapidly emerging field! We are expanding our existing team and are looking for passionate talent across APAC to be part of this exciting journey. If you are inspired to take up new challenges and leave a mark on the e-commerce landscape, then come and be part of our growing ShopBack Family!

Job Title: Decision Scientist - Valuation, Business Modelling, Transaction Advisory Services
Job Description:
Join Valuation and Business Modeling and you join a team of experienced professionals who bring to clients excellence in accounting, taxation and financial due diligence. You will help guide clients through the model review, model support and model-build activities necessary to make key decisions and improve strategic outcomes. With over 1,600 valuation professionals worldwide, no similarly positioned global professional organization can match our breadth of capabilities or our depth of resources.

With so many offerings, you have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.


The opportunity

We currently have an opportunity for a Consultant specialising in data / decision science to join our talented Valuation, Modelling and Economics group within Transaction Advisory Services in Singapore. We work across all industries and operate in a broad range of disciplines including data analytics and visualisation, operational research, simulation and optimisation, transaction and decision support modelling, advanced economic modelling and bespoke model development.

Your key responsibilities

In your role, you will have a primary focus on decision science and decision modelling. Your focus will be on the application of analytics, operational research and modelling techniques across a range of industries and problem types. You will use advanced simulation modelling and experimentation techniques and have a strong grasp of the use of statistics. You are resourceful, know how to solve problems and have a good understanding of mathematical optimization. Your work will provide in-depth insights and inform the strategic decision-making of our clients on their key capital investment and operational issues. This will allow you to develop and maintain positive, productive and professional advisory relationships with clients and stakeholders.

Skills and attributes for success
Good commercial acumen with excellent interpersonal and client management skills
Experience and understanding of the operational aspects across a range of industries
Strong data analysis and presentation / visualisation skills including the ability to identify, extract, manipulate and use statistical methods to analyse large data sets, identify trends and patterns and the ability to uncover stories and in-depth insights
Good model building skills combined with an ability to connect these with real world strategic alternatives, decisions and applications
Intellectual curiosity, strong problem solving abilities and a commercial mindset
Excellent analytical, communication and teamwork skills
To qualify for the role you must have
A bachelor's degree (or higher) in statistics, applied mathematics, data science, engineering, operational research, computer science / software engineering or similar
Knowledge of operational research, management science and optimisation techniques
Experience in the use of statistical programming packages (SAS, SPSS, R, Python) and making this accessible to others (e.g. through related software such as R Shiny)
Experience with data visualization (Tableau, Power BI and/or Spotfire)
Experience in the use of bespoke simulation modelling tools (e.g. AnyLogic, Arena, WITNESS, Extendsim, FlexSim, Simul8 etc.)
Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript etc.)
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and SQL / database environments
Capabilities in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint are required
Excellent spoken and written communication skills
Ideally, you also have
Programming experience in Java/C#/VB.net/Javascript etc.
What we look for


What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to supporting your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.



What working at EY offers


EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Join us in building a better working world.


Apply today.

MORE ABOUT THIS JOB


WHO WE ARE

Goldman Sachs is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of services worldwide to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and high net-worth individuals. Founded in 1869, it is one of the oldest and largest investment banking firms in the world. The firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in London, Bangalore, Frankfurt, Tokyo, Hong Kong and other major financial centres around the world. We are committed to growing our distinctive culture and upholding our core values, which always place our client's interests first. These values are reflected in our Business Principles, which emphasise integrity, commitment to excellence, innovation and teamwork.

OUR IMPACT

Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all areas of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the globe. Alongside this integral service delivery role, Operations provides essential risk management and control, preserving and enhancing the firm’s assets and its reputation. Behind every trade executed, every new product launched, every market entered, and every transaction completed is an Operations team that develops the foundational processes and controls that make our business flow.

YOUR IMPACT

A successful candidate would be establishing a Centre of Excellence for Innovation in Singapore including responsibility for the hiring program and leading the automation and innovation strategy. Through deploying the strategy, they will utilize their skills in machine learning, statistics, data science, process re-engineering, and/or programming to help leverage big data analytics to solve impactful business questions. The role would include collaborating with other groups across the federation, business and globe, with the opportunity to work cross-function and cross-business.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITY

This role provides a unique opportunity to build an lead the Centre of Excellence, a team that will have a significant impact on the operating model of the region going forward. Through this, the role will provide exposure to senior stakeholders, offering excellent opportunities for career development.

Job Description:
About Cubist
Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources.
Job Description
Under the guidance of the Portfolio Manager, the candidate’s main responsibility will be researching and developing novel systematic trading models in a financial setting.
A successful candidate will go through all aspects of the research process, including methodology selection, data collection and analysis, implementation and testing, prototyping, and performance evaluation.
Requirements
PhD in computer science, engineering, mathematics, physics, or other quantitative discipline.
Post-doctorate research experience is a plus.
Experience programming in MATLAB or Python.
Interest in quant trading and curiosity about financial markets – prior experience in finance is not required.
Clear, concise, and proactive communicator.
Detail-oriented.
Willing to take ownership of his/her work, working both independently and within a small team.

What You Do:
Within our Process Solutions (PS) Business Tools & Digitalization Organization, the Business Data Analyst will report to the Head of Global Transformation & Analytics. With the significant contribution of business tools and analytics in the daily work of the Process Solutions (PS) commercial organization, this role is responsible for understanding a variety of data sources and points of tool and data integration including but not limited to Salesforce, ERPs, BI and Tableau and make them match to global business priorities.

Develop optimal global solutions for commercial dashboard requests in SFDC, Tableau or other tools to provide a leadership level view of global data will incorporating drill down to regional data as needed.
Gather business requirements, analyze global report/dashboard feasibility and when not feasible for a regional request, manage local report and dashboard requirements and delivery.
Use data visualization elements like charts, graphs, and maps, provide PS business users with guidance and an accessible way to see and interpret trends, outliers, and patterns in data.
Bases on learned expert knowledge of PS data and the benefits our tools can bring to the organization, proactively identify and socialize trends in data and target group that could leverage from use of the data to drive business decisions.
Drive data quality efforts utilizing Demand Tools and other applications.
Implement change in process/policy and coordinate efficiency efforts to reduce administrative & redundant work.
Develop educational pathways for relevant projects to ensure that our PS business partners utilize our Business tools to their optimum potential, across the geographies and are fully aware of the benefits and impact of programs implemented.
Serve as a key contributor to regional and global projects and initiatives.
Work with regional commercial partners to gather and translate local requirements into global projects, the analyst will collaborate with IT, Program Leads and Life Science colleagues to match local specifications to our global framework and will provide a platform for communication of assigned projects and tool enhancements to ensure stakeholder/partner involvement and awareness remains active.

Who You Are:
Master/Bachelor’s Degree in relevant discipline
4+ years of Salesforce administration experience preferable in an environment that utilizes custom objects as well as out of the box functionality. Preferably Certified Salesforce.com Administrator
3+ years of sales operations, sales tools, process optimization, sales training (or any subset of these)
Experience with Microsoft Office Tools including Excel and Power Point to generate status updates and other forms of communication
Experience with SFDC Reporting/Dashboards and with Analytics tools Tableau, Power BI
Excellent interpersonal skills and prior work experience within a multi-national, multi-cultural organization
Understanding of the Pharmaceutical/Biopharmaceutical/Life Sciences Business Environment
Ability to work independently and develop personal initiatives
Sense of confidentiality, well-structured and disciplined
Aptitude with the back end of mobile tools, such as supporting Salesforce mobile applications
Able to meet the challenges of a fast-paced, high energy environment, while maintaining a strong level of professionalism, interpersonal communication, proactive problem solving and critical attention to quality
Ability to be extremely responsive to internal and external customer needs
Occasional travel expected

Data Science Lead is part of Data Science workstream within Analytics Centre of Excellence(CoE), responsible for increase the maturity of Prudential Singapore current decision sciences with Cognitive, AI and Machine learning capabilities while aligning with existing analytics models

Job Description:
Primary responsibility for successful delivery of the algorithms, statistical models and reporting tools to meet Prudential business needs. Acts as the analytic team lead for large and complex projects involving multiple resources and tasks, providing individual mentoring in support of company objectives.
Develop, build and train machine learning models using wide range of machine learning tools and frameworks, such as Theano, Tensorflow, Caffe, Torch, etc
Lead and coach Data Science teams with machine learning algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networks
Performs analyses of structured and unstructured data to solve multiple and/or complex business problems utilizing advanced statistical techniques and mathematical analyses and broad knowledge of the organization and/or industry.
Generate new calculated features that improve the predictive of statistical relationships
Condense complex analysis and technical concepts into clear and concise takeaways for business leaders
Collaborates with business partners to understand their problems and goals, develop predictive modeling, statistical analysis, data reports and performance metrics.
Train ML Models based on predictive algorithms
Use strong knowledge in algorithms and predictive models to investigate problems, detect patterns and recommend solutions.

Subject Matter Expertise in effective machine learning tools and technologies including Tensorflow, Spark/Spark MLib, Flink, Mahout or any packaged cognitive solutions
Subject Matter Expertise with application of machine learning concepts and techniques (linear/logistic regression, clustering, classification, PCA, Naive Bayes, association rules, Collaborative Filtering, recommendation techniques, Neural Nets, etc.

Strong knowledge of advanced analytics tools and languages to analyze large data sets from multiple data sources.
Demonstrates proficiency in most areas of mathematical analysis methods, machine learning, statistical analyses, and predictive modeling and in-depth specialization in some areas.
Database programming experience both in SQL(MS SQL, Oracle) as well as NoSQL Databases(MongoDB, CouchDB, etc)
Deep Expertise in Data Visualization including Matplotlib, plot.ly, C4.js, Dataiku, Tableau, Highcharts, ggplot etc)
Deep expertise with large datasets and distributed architectures like Hadoop/Spark and open source data mining and machine learning frameworks
Deep expertise in creating interface specification documents, attribute mapping documents, functional specifications
Experience with web scraping
Experience with Text Matching applications
Education
PhD STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) degree with 1 years’ experience or Masters STEM degree with 5 years’ experience or Bachelor's STEM degree with 6 years required

Job Description:
Appier is a technology company which aims to provide artificial intelligence platforms to help enterprises solve their most challenging business problems. Appier was established in 2012 by a passionate team of computer scientists and engineers with expertise in AI, data analysis, distributed systems, and marketing.

About the role

The Data Science Consultant combines deep Data Science/AI expertise with a keen understanding of business practices to increase Appier's customers' usage of Appier's AI products. This is a customer facing role that works closely with Sales and Customer Success to help Appier's customers succeed with AI.

The Data Science Consultant will have a solid technical understanding of various concepts and models in AI. The ideal candidate will have hands-on, industry experience in applying Data Science models into production, and understands the pros and cons of different solutions. He/she will be able to leverage his/her experience and knowledge to recommend the best use cases for the customers, and drive the execution of the deliverables. Internally, this role will serve as the go-to expert to answer any Data Science/AI related questions from Appier's Sales and Customer Success teams.

Communication skills are essential for this role. The Data Science consultant is able to easily explain difficult AI concepts to business users of varying technical levels, ranging from C-levels to marketers to other data scientists. This role will also work closely with Marketing and PR to determine the right messaging. He/she will be expected to author blogs, white-papers, and present at events, meetups and conferences.

Task of the role

Participate in sales cycles and customer implementations to explain the inner workings of Appier's product and AI offerings
Identify customer business pain points, and propose creative use cases utilizing on Appier's AI product and service capabilities
Drive the delivery of customized analyses and insights to the customer, from initial problem definition, scoping of the project, to final delivery and presentation of the results
Become an expert with our product suite, able to deliver standard and customized presentations of Appier SaaS enterprise AI solutions and demos to business management
Work with Product Marketing to develop messaging to speak to audiences of different technical backgrounds and levels
Evangelize the use of AI in business and Appier's role as a leader in the AI space through blog posts, meetups, and conferences

About you

[Essential]

Excellent English presentation and writing skills
Minimum 5 years applying Data Science/AI in an industry production setting
MS/PhD in a relevant technical field such as Operations Research, Computer Science, Statistics, Management Science
Ability to communicate Data Science/AI concepts effectively to customers' mid/senior management as well as C-level executives
Ability to propose end-to-end Data Science/AI based solutions to address vague business problems
Experience with Python, SQL, and one or more BI tools
Up to 50% travel

[Nice to have]

Experience in a consulting role
Familiarity with big data engineering technologies like Spark or Cassandra etc
Experience in a SaaS and/or B2B product setting

Why join us?

We believe in building a great working environment where passionate individual can give their best, and to work with a talented team. To reward Appiers for their contribution, we also work hard to offer perks and benefits to make their life better

Perks and benefits

Company office locations at the heart of central business district (CBD) in all our countries.

Well stocked pantry with snacks and drinks

Competitive salary

Equity in one of the most exciting Artificial Intelligence startup in Asia

Health insurance for all employees

Your choice between Mac and Microsoft OS

Frequent company and team gatherings to celebrate success and life in general

Roles & Responsibilities

About Rakuten Institute of Technology (RIT)

Rakuten Institute of Technology (RIT) is a think-tank and technology incubator for Rakuten Group – focusing on data R&D and strategic technology development.

With offices in Tokyo, Boston, Paris, India and Singapore, RIT contributions cover a broad range of topics, including Data Mining, Natural Language Processing, High-performance computing, UI/UX, and multimedia processing.

Scope

Rakuten Institute of Technology (RIT) is looking for Researchers who are passionate about data and technology. As part of RIT, you will have an exciting opportunity to accelerate growth of existing Rakuten businesses, and to drive innovation with long-term benefits for the company; while collaborating closely with research, engineering, and business teams globally.

Responsibilities

Be an expert and drive research results in one or more of the below areas:
Machine Learning, Statistics, Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems, Natural Language Processing, Machine Translation, Sentiment Analysis, Graph Analysis, Computer Vision, Augmented/Virtual Reality, Other emerging technologies
Deliver results: Develop new technologies, improve business performance
Demonstrate long-term vision, while effectively supporting short-term goals
Be a thought-leader, keeping up with the academic and industry trend

Rakuten is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age.

Job Title: Data Analytics Manager, Financial Accounting Advisory Services, Assurance
Job Description:
Join Financial Accounting Advisory Services within Assurance and you will assist our clients to address the accounting and financial reporting challenges facing their business. You will be part of a team that provides insight and services that accelerate analytics, decision-making and innovation to build a stronger and more efficient finance function.

You will experience ongoing professional development through diverse experiences, world-class learning and individually tailored coaching. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because your professional development is important to us and we are fully committed to helping you realise your potential.

The opportunity

The Financial Accounting Advisory Services (FAAS) team works with businesses and finance teams to address the risks of accounting, financial reporting and regulatory issues. By translating data into insights around financial statements and operations, FAAS Data Analytics help clients identify unrealized and often unexpected potential, and achieve a new level of insight and performance. With FAAS Data Analytics, finance teams can make better decisions as they can understand what has happened and why, and then predict what may happen next.

Your key responsibilities

As a FAAS Data Analytics Manager, you will be a key member of the team, committed to initiating and maintaining meaningful relationships with clients and other service lines in EY. You enjoy engaging current and prospective clients because you strongly believe that they will benefit from our inputs as finance and accounting advisors. Leveraging off our pool of consultants and resources, you will manage the project teams to ensure the successful delivery of services to our clients.

Skills and attributes for success
Manage the execution of data analytics projects to help clients solve business problems, drive value, and gain strategy and insight from information.
Critically analyse and review the use of advanced data analysis techniques that leverage technology to process large volumes of data, and perform complex computations in a scalable, reproducible and automated manner.
As a key member of a team, manage the implementation of integrated enterprise-wide reporting solutions for data transformation and delivery.
Perform data analytics to help solve business challenges and achieve data automation, reconciliation, traceability, lineage and transparency.
Use data analytics to provide actionable, timely and accurate data to drive business insights around customer, regulatory risk, compliance, operations and finance, rationalizing and/or maximizing the existing data infrastructure to achieve greater return on investment.
Manage and motivate teams with diverse skills and backgrounds.
Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress
Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge
Maintain long-term client relationships and networks
Cultivate business development opportunities.

To qualify for the role you must have
A degree, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Econometrics, Engineering, Physics, Statistics, (Applied) Mathematics or Actuarial Sciences.
Minimum 6 years of professional experience.
Familiar with data sourcing, data capture, data transformation and data preparation techniques.
Knowledge of databases, Extract-Transform-Load, and hands on experience / theoretical knowledge in SQL including writing stored procedures and data extraction / manipulation using queries.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Spotfire, Qlikview, etc.
Working knowledge of core financial processes (e.g. purchase to pay, order to cash) and related risks and controls, and/or experience working on finance-related systems implementation projects.
Solution-oriented with “go-getter” personality.
Willing to try new ways to solve old problems.
Able to motivate and develop team members.
Confident, independent and adaptable.
Excellent verbal/written communication skills.
Strong organizational, project management and analytical skills.

Ideally, you also have
Previous experience in Data Analytics consulting, managing a diverse client portfolio.
Good understanding of, and practical experience with, analytical techniques and tools for predictive analytics (SAS, Enterprise Miner, Modeler, R, Python).
Working knowledge of the process flows, underlying data structures and configuration of major ERP systems (e.g. Oracle, SAP, Peoplesoft, Dynamics).
Experience with BluePrism, Automation Anywhere and/or UI Path.
What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you will be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.

What working at EY offers

EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you will be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:

· Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around

·
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

· The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we will make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

Job Title: AVP, Senior Data Scientist, DBS Transformation Group, Technology and Operations
Job Description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Responsibilities

The Analytics Center of Excellence is established as the central team to develop the machine learning practice for DBS Group. The senior data scientist/machine learning engineer in Analytics Center of Excellence will have opportunities to work on huge varieties of problems across sales and marketing, customer management, revenue optimization, risk prevention, operation efficiency, network monitoring, AML and many more other areas.

We work with business to implement high performance advanced analytics solutions using Python/Spark/R. The successful candidate will lead the efforts to propose advanced analytics to drive business value, including:

Understand the business domain and relevant dataset
Provide end-to-end advanced solutions to design, develop and deploy to production system
Build the CI-CD practice to manage models regarding quick experiments and feedback loop
Communicate/Interpret analytics result and machine learning model details with business and stakeholders
Lead junior staff, help them learn and grow

Requirements

Excellent problem solving and advanced data science/analytics skills.
PhD in NLP with 3 years of industry experience developing data science solutions primary of machine learning nature or software development experience.
Familiarity with the process of developing and implementing industrial standard machine learning solutions for classification, prediction, text mining and anomality detection problems.
Proficiency with programming in Spark, Python or R.
Extensive experience in the following areas: NLP, deep learning, NER, event detection, document analysis, etc.
Good problem solving, communication, lateral thinking and presentation skill.

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job Title: Data Science Strategist, Mobile & Connectivity Partnerships
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.We believe connecting the world is one of the greatest challenges of our generation, and that everyone deserves access to the knowledge, tools and opportunities that come from being connected. But to connect the unconnected, we need to start with data to understand existing infrastructure coverage, network performance and areas of gaps. If you have a passion working with vast amounts of data to recommend solutions that enable or improve the internet delivery to the unconnected as you engage with senior executives or major operators then this is a great role for you. Successful candidates will have a strong technical & data mining skillset, as well as client-facing experience and enjoy the balance of both. You will engage with key partners on all levels including C-suite, delivering strategic business value from our insights products/data as part of unique partnership. At the same time you can be scrappy, focused on results, are a self-starter and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the growth and success of a business. Your proven track record of thought leadership and impact in developing analytics and metrics based programs speaks for itself.

Responsibilities:

Lead partnership programs with operators and infrastructure partners using data analytics, metrics and tools to help them transform their networks and infrastructure
Engage with CTO teams of Mobile Network Operator partners using data analytics, metrics and tools to help them transform their networks and infrastructure.
Use network performance, coverage and other data layers (population density, income levels, etc.) to conduct gap analysis and ultimately recommend infrastructure expansion such as fiber routes and wireless backhaul to connect telecom towers and POPs.
Actively improve the business model development of our Connectivity programs by representing global partner performance and feedback in our HQ, and to inform, influence and support product roadmaps
Leverage visualization and mapping tools such as Tableau, Excel and other data analytics tools to conduct analysis, produce charts/graphs and support partner/internal engagements.
Mininum Qualifications:

BA/BS/BEng or higher degree with emphasis in electrical/network engineering, computer science, analytics, statistics, economics or equivalent degree/experience.
8+ years experience in quantitative analysis, focused on goal driven optimization of large scale problems.
Experience working with large data-sets and excellent data mining skills. Statistical analysis understanding is required. Fluency in SQL or other data programming languages.
Project management experience, with the ability to lead and execute multiple time-sensitive projects with partners.
Good communication and presentation skills, and the ability to clarify and summarize complex issues for C-levels.
Track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner.
Ability to travel internationally, up to 30% of the time. Comfort working across time zones, remote teams and cultures required.
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working on network performance and analytics for an operator, equipment vendor deploying or operating telecom networks, or for a consulting firm with focus on analytics.
Knowledge of telecom infrastructure network principles, coverage and capacity requirements.
Familiarity of network metrics, measurements and performance data, among them: coverage requirement for 2G, 3G, 4G, or performance metrics such as latency, jitter and throughput calculations.

The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be world-class in delivering a safe and secure home for our people. In pursuing our mission to help make Singapore safe and secure, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity.

We utilise state-of-the-art technology and technical know-how to safeguard Singapore’s security and sovereignty. We need highly motivated Data Analytics Engineers to design and build powerful data science and analytics tools required to conduct data mining and facilitate data-driven decision making.

Besides being passionate about data, analytics and software engineering, candidates should also be driven by our mission to make Singapore a safer home, and enjoy working on challenging, diverse and unique problem statements. Evaluate, adopt, integrate and build on open-source and commercial analytics tools
Work closely with end users, data scientists, data engineers and project managers in the planning, development and delivery of solutions
Evaluate, maintain and optimise code for accuracy, performance, maintainability and scale of data queries, machine learning models and data visualizations
Recommend and evaluate technologies to introduce new analytics capabilities

Singapore Citizens only.
Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply.
Self-motivated, open-minded, resourceful and meticulous. Able to work independently and in teams.
Ability to keep the overarching objectives of the project in mind while pursuing the technical details.
Competent in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Java, JavaScript, C/C++, C#, base SAS, R, Scala). Interest and ability to gain expertise in other programming languages, frameworks and technologies.
Familiarity with one or more database and its related querying languages (e.g. SQL, Pig, Hive, SparkQL).
Knowledge and experience with any of the following would be an advantage:
o Machine learning (e.g. predictive analytics, natural language processing)
o Data analytics (e.g. descriptive statistics, modelling)
o Big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Impala, HBase, Elasticsearch)
o Web development (e.g. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Ruby on Rails)
o Data visualisation (e.g. UX/UI design, PowerBI, D3, Tableau)
o System administration (e.g. OS, networking, databases)
o Containers technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Stealth Travel Venture

BCG Digital Ventures is an ever-growing global team of entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, venture architects, product experts and investors. 5+ years of commercial experience in industry as a Data Scientist

Masters Degree or above with research experience in ML/AI
Deep knowledge in Deep learning tools and platforms
Deep knowledge in Graph database
Good understanding of Agile methodology in software development

The team will be responsible for the development and solutioning of the Customer Science Platform. The focus is on real time predictive analytics to derive actionable insights to intervene positively in the customer’s digital journey.

The required roles will focus on 3 broad areas; Data Engineers, Data Analyst / Modelling, and Data Visualizers. You will be working with a team of Scientists as well as supervising a team of Laboratory Officers to manage the forensic analysis of drug exhibits submitted by the law enforcement agencies. Based on the various scientific results gathered, you will interpret the data and issue formal reports. When necessary, you will also give evidence in court as an expert witness to testify on the scientific process of analysis.

You will need to keep abreast of the latest technologies that can advance the forensic capabilities in drug testing and also conduct research in developing new analytical methods for the identification of unknowns.

Requirements:
At least a Degree in Chemistry or related field
At least 2 years of experience working in an analytical laboratory
Keen interest in analytical work and relevant experience in analytical techniques such as LC, GC, NMR, mass spectrometry, IR etc
Experience in structural elucidation will be an advantage
Excellent written technical and oral communications skills
Able to work independently with a good sense of team spirit
Able to multi-task and has good task management skills
Meticulous, innovative and possess strong critical thinking skills
Kindly note that only shortlisted applicants will be notified
[CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

Job Description


Reports to: Pharmaceutical Research Manager (Asia)

Position Purpose: To lead analytical development and support activities for small molecular pharmaceutical and food products in R&D and Customer Technical Services organizations.

Position Scope: Local

Positions reporting to this position: None

Job Description

This role is based in a laboratory specializing in physicochemical analysis of small molecule pharmaceutical and food products, and plant based excipient compounds (starches, hydrocolloids, polyols, protein molecules) using various analytical methods and equipment. The role supports the analytical needs of R&D and Customer Technical Service departments, and external partners. Specific descriptions on the job scope are outlined as follows:
Leveraging on Analytical Expertise help to develop Innovation Strategies to expand Roquette Portfolio of products
Lead analytical investigations for new and existing products in partnership with R&D and customer technical services, referring to compendial methods and regulatory guidelines, where available
Lead the development of new and innovative protocols, techniques, methods of analysis or propose improvements to existing methods when compendial or commonly used methods are not available
Process and report analytical data using instrument software, Office software or equivalent
Evaluate feasibility of new and existing analytical methods and equipment
Integrate new and/or existing analytical techniques and adapt them to acquire more physicochemical and structural information on products
Provide analytical support (e.g. solid state characterization, rheological analysis, physicochemical evaluation) in customer technical application studies
Determine with the team manager the specific programs of study or analytical development according to technical constraints
Schedule activities and organize work to meet study requirements in a timely, cost effective manner
Support departmental activities including internal training and presenting scientific results at internal meetings
Participate in general lab up-keeping activities such as ordering supplies, troubleshooting and up-keeping of instrumentation, performing calibrations, and chemical inventory records. Carry out close liaison and proactive follow-up with vendors on some of these activities
Maintain instrumentation and ensure compliance to hygiene, safety and quality standards
REQUIREMENTS
Singapore citizen or permanent resident
Advanced Degree (PhD or MSc) in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmacy or other Life Sciences degrees
PhD graduates with a minimum 3 years, MSc with a minimum of 6 years of related experience, and BSc with a minimum of 10 years of experience.
Related experience refers experience in solid-state characterization (DSC, TGA, XRD, microscopy, moisture sorption, particle characterization, interaction studies, etc.), rheological characterization and physicochemical evaluation (solubility, pKa, etc.)
Basic understanding of pharmaceutical process technologies such as granulation and tableting would an advantage
Adaptable and solutions driven with strong problem solving abilities
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work in cross functional teams and build positive working relationships
Hands on person and able to multi task
Fluent in English

Job Description


Reports to: Pharmaceutical Research Manager (Asia)

Position Purpose: Conduct scientific research work in the small molecular Pharma fields to meet team objectives and company roadmap.

Position Scope: Local / Regional (Asia coverage but based in Singapore)

Positions reporting to this position: None. Opportunities to supervise and mentor research interns and PhD students are available.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities

This role is based in a laboratory specializing in formulation and process development for Roquette’s plant based excipients using various processing technologies commonly used by the pharmaceutical industry as well as newer processing technologies. The role requires extensive hands-on laboratory work and supports other scientists within the team, R&D departments within Roquette network and external partners. In operational terms, the duties and responsibilities includes the following:
Lead projects and execute research activities within the scope of Pharmaceutical research fields. This encompasses preformulation and formulation studies up to the processing of end product prototypes
Extension of work scope to consumer product applications is possible
Process and report analytical data using instrument software, Office software or equivalent
Communicate: externally, through scientific articles, for publication, patents, posters or oral presentations, and internally through appropriate communication tools for marketing and business teams
Write position papers to provide evaluation of new and existing products and develop research proposals
Determine with the team manager the specific programs of study or formulation development according to technical constraints
Schedule activities and organize work to meet study requirements in a timely, cost effective manner
Organization of daily work: flow analysis, urgency and duration of formulation development activities
REQUIREMENTS
Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident
Advanced Degree (PhD or MSc) in Pharmaceutics, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Pharmaceutical Engineering or Material Science
MSc with 6+ years of related experience and PhD with 3+ years of related experience
Specialized skills in pharmaceutical formulation and manufacturing technologies is preferred
Innovative mindset around scientific topics
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills. Able to manage internal and external customers
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience in Pharmaceutical R&D focusing on needs of Asian, as well as global customers
Fluent in English, and working knowledge of a local Asian language a plus
Relations / Collaboration

The role requires collaboration with various internal & external groups:
Corporate and Regional R&D centres
Legal (IP) & Regulatory Affairs
Public Affairs
GBU’s, Marketing and Business Development
Product Line Managers
External Research Institutes and Universities
Level of Innovation
Create/Conceptualize, breakthrough

Data Science Lead is part of Data Science workstream within Analytics Centre of Excellence(CoE), responsible for increase the maturity of Prudential Singapore current decision sciences with Cognitive, AI and Machine learning capabilities while aligning with existing analytics models

Job Description:
Primary responsibility for successful delivery of the algorithms, statistical models and reporting tools to meet Prudential business needs. Acts as the analytic team lead for large and complex projects involving multiple resources and tasks, providing individual mentoring in support of company objectives.
Develop, build and train machine learning models using wide range of machine learning tools and frameworks, such as Theano, Tensorflow, Caffe, Torch, etc
Lead and coach Data Science teams with machine learning algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networks
Performs analyses of structured and unstructured data to solve multiple and/or complex business problems utilizing advanced statistical techniques and mathematical analyses and broad knowledge of the organization and/or industry.
Generate new calculated features that improve the predictive of statistical relationships
Condense complex analysis and technical concepts into clear and concise takeaways for business leaders
Collaborates with business partners to understand their problems and goals, develop predictive modeling, statistical analysis, data reports and performance metrics.
Train ML Models based on predictive algorithms
Use strong knowledge in algorithms and predictive models to investigate problems, detect patterns and recommend solutions.
Who we are looking for:
Subject Matter Expertise in effective machine learning tools and technologies including Tensorflow, Spark/Spark MLib, Flink, Mahout or any packaged cognitive solutions
Subject Matter Expertise with application of machine learning concepts and techniques (linear/logistic regression, clustering, classification, PCA, Naive Bayes, association rules, Collaborative Filtering, recommendation techniques, Neural Nets, etc.
Subject Matter Expertise in high-level scripting languages for statistical and scientific computing including Python, R, Scala, or PySpark
Strong knowledge of advanced analytics tools and languages to analyze large data sets from multiple data sources.
Demonstrates proficiency in most areas of mathematical analysis methods, machine learning, statistical analyses, and predictive modeling and in-depth specialization in some areas.
Database programming experience both in SQL(MS SQL, Oracle) as well as NoSQL Databases(MongoDB, CouchDB, etc)
Deep Expertise in Data Visualization including Matplotlib, plot.ly, C4.js, Dataiku, Tableau, Highcharts, ggplot etc)
Deep expertise with large datasets and distributed architectures like Hadoop/Spark and open source data mining and machine learning frameworks
Deep expertise in creating interface specification documents, attribute mapping documents, functional specifications
Experience with web scraping
Experience with Text Matching applications
Education
PhD STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) degree with 1 years’ experience or Masters STEM degree with 5 years’ experience or Bachelor's STEM degree with 6 years required

Roles & Responsibilities

Scientist - Biotechnology

Scientist - Biotechnology leads the development and execution of technical projects aimed to deliver step-change innovation to Kinnva via biotechnology. The candidate will be a key input provider, and may be called to lead, strategy development of new and/or emerging technologies in the field of biotechnology applicable to cross category product development for innovation and productivity initiatives. Leveraging on strong fundamental science, the candidate is expected to develop hypotheses and conceptual models that deliver technical application/processes relevance across multiple snack categories. An independent thinker, the individual plans, and conducts experiments, working with cross functional teams within and outside the organization. They deliver results, interpretation, technical memos and author technical reports. This person is a technical interface for the company to external research organizations and industry groups. Fundamental understanding is applied to analysis of results to drive business relevant recommendations.

Position Accountability Summary
Scientific/Knowledge development
Develop novel food and feed ingredients based on biotransformation, leveraging fermentation, microbiology and enzymes to create/improve functionality in applications that enable the growth strategy of Kinnva to be fulfilled.
Develop novel fermentation systems including culture selection and/or development via classic microbial methods or via genetic manipulation techniques.
Conduct scientific experiments to establish understanding of fermentation mechanisms and conditions that drive optimal process in delivering functionalities in food and feed applications
Make recommendations for scaling up fermentation systems
Interpret data, findings or results and define subsequent steps while demonstrating sound scientific know-how and capability to link findings to business objectives.
Lead the formulation of hypotheses and design solid experimental plans to prove these, conduct appropriate testing, gather and analyse data/findings/results and define subsequent steps while demonstrating sound scientific know-how and capability to link findings to business objectives
Formulate recommendations so that results can be used and implemented in cross category food and feed applications
Using understandings of the role of various microbial ecosystems and potential target biochemicals and biomaterials to develop product focus applications
Be the technical lead for scale-up projects conducted with Contract Labs and Contract Manufacturing organisations.
Identify and champion intellectual property opportunities in the area of biotechnology. Publish patents in the relevant fields that deliver innovation
Operational excellence
Lead several projects or multiple project tracks. Projects typically span two categories or more. Projects focus on priority new technologies typically delivering revenue and involve leading cross functional teams or supporting ambitious growth plans in developing markets.
Leads and aligns with cross-functional partners. Manages relationships with suppliers and business partners in Food and Feed Nutrition. Able to partner with cross-functional teams & drive solutions.
Mentor, coach and guide the work planning of junior team members and supervise the technical content of their day-to-day work.
Engage in scientific developments within the field of expertise through e.g. involvement & leadership in external scientific institutions, government bodies & industry relevant committees.
Building and maintaining alliances with strategic external partners for deep research in various biotechnology fields
Assist in the production of samples for analysis or consumer testing using pilot-scale manufacturing equipment as needed.
Communication/Project management
Update and communicate progress and results to Platform Manager/Director or other relevant stakeholders. Effectively structure and present status updates / proposals to influence partners or share with higher management.
Collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders in Research & Nutrition to ensure that timescales and other requirements are met.
Build and manage internal relationships with peers and other technical specialists in R&D.
Establish an external network with relevant suppliers and academia. Be informed of the external developments by visiting conferences and reading relevant literature. Foster new collaboration opportunities.
Deliver results and interpretation, draw conclusions with business relevant recommendations at review meetings and write technical memos and author technical reports.
Quality/Environmental/Health/Safety compliance
Work to the highest standards of safety and quality by ensuring that appropriate training, risk assessments and SOP (standard of procedures) are read before starting work. Ensure training records and other required documents are accurate.
Qualifications

Education, Knowledge, Experience
PhD in: Biotechnology (preferred), Microbiology, Biochemistry, Food Science, Food/Chemical Engineering, or science-related field
8-10 years of post-PhD experience working with difference microbial systems in the industry or with industrial partners
Broad understanding of the key branches of biotechnology, such as microbial ecology, molecular biology, microbial physiology, biochemistry, and fermentation and in-depth knowledge in one of them, ideally Liquid-to-Liquid and Gas-to-Liquid fermentation.
Candidate will have specialist knowledge of the use of bacterial strain cultures
Good understanding of Upstream and Downstream Processing and chemistry of food/feed products, analytical testing, formulations and processing used in food and feed manufacture
Understanding of the functionality of ingredients, general knowledge of ways to manipulate those ingredients, and the inter-relationship of ingredient/process/packaging
Ability to work with suppliers to deliver technical components
Research project management

Want to be part of a revolution in digital entertainment? Were Audible, an Amazon company, and were the leading digital provider of spoken word entertainment. Based in Singapore, the position of Business Analytics Manager offers the right candidate the opportunity to make a big impact on the success of the business overall. This role needs an independent, analytical self-starter to take a leading role in supporting key decision making with metrics reporting, and customer behavior analysis to provide insight in a rapidly growing business. Sharp problem solving skills, experience with advanced SQL, the ability to manipulate data and apply these to business issues, are the keys to success for this position.

Key Accountabilities:
· Maintain a deep understanding of business drivers and an innate grasp of business metrics definitions, and pro-actively interact with business to give context and help them better understand reporting data.
· Leverage SQL, MicroStrategy, excel and other reporting tools to create and maintain scheduled and Adhoc reports.
· Monitor data on a day to day basis to identify variances in performance and dive deep to identify trends/foresee business problems
· Working with marketing and product teams to track and measure effectiveness of marketing campaigns and product launches.
· Work with product and marketing partners to size and prioritize business opportunities.
· Partner with the Country Manager and finance partner to assist with creating business models that support major investments, partnerships, initiatives and projects that deliver sound commercial outcomes.
· Analyze data to identify business problems and lead deep dives to perform root cause analysis.
· Conduct ad-hoc analysis of business issues through database querying to capture data, followed by relevant excel analysis and interpretation of results

Basic Qualifications

· Bachelors Degree in MIS, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business or a related field
· Proven commercial experience in a similar company would be preferred
· Extensive Knowledge of database software, Excel, and demonstrated advanced knowledge of SQL
· Strong research, analytical/decision making and problem solving skills
· Ability to deep dive and solve complex business related problems.




Preferred Qualifications

· Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and ideas in a non-technical, simple manner across all levels of the organization
· Resourceful self-starter with an independent attitude, focus on excellence, and attention to detail
· Ability to operate in a high-energy, high-intensity and rapidly evolving environment
· Solid organizational and project management skills are also required along with the ability to work with cross functional teams under aggressive deadlines

Responsibilities:
You will be working with a team of Scientists as well as supervising a team of Laboratory Officers to manage the forensic analysis of drug exhibits submitted by the law enforcement agencies. When necessary, you will also give evidence in court as an expert witness to testify on the scientific process of analysis.

You will need to keep abreast of the latest technologies that can advance the forensic capabilities in drug testing and also conduct research in developing new analytical methods for the identification of unknowns.

At least 2 years of experience working in an analytical laboratory
Keen interest in analytical work and relevant experience in analytical techniques such as LC, GC, NMR, mass spectrometry, IR etc
Experience in structural elucidation will be an advantage
Excellent written technical and oral communications skills
Able to work independently with a good sense of team spirit
Able to multi-task and has good task management skills
Meticulous, innovative and possess strong critical thinking skills
