Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Data Hub, Strategic Communications & Insights
Job Description: Senior Data Analyst – Data Hub, Strategic Communications & Insights

Overview of the job

As Data Engineer Manager you are expected to lead the implementation of ETL processes throughout the design, build and maintenance phases of large projects. You are expected to demonstrate the following skills/experience: in managing large data sets, familiarity with big-data concepts, cloud computing, open-source tools, and optimization techniques, excellent oral and written communication skills, client focus and the ability to lead and encourage teamwork.

Reporting Manager: Associate Director, Data Management

3 best things about the job:
Be part of a dynamic team, responsible for harnessing the power of data and technology to provide timely, actionable business insights to our clients
Be part of a global Centre of Excellence and work for clients across the globe
Learn and develop yourself in cutting edge technologies and platforms in the field of data and analytics

Measures of success:
You should be able to:
In 3 months:
Manage data architecture requirements and data processing schedules
Manage the retrieving, compiling, and formatting of large volumes of data to business specification
Train and guide Data Engineers to build and maintain ETL processes
Schedule and automate data management processes where possible

In 6 months:
Optimize data processes to ensure quality, repeatable output with minimal human intervention
Implement data QA process across various platforms
Manage project timelines and deliverable schedules
Manage communications across a globally distributed team
Review team output and manage team progress on daily basis

In 12 months:
Independently design, build, and deploy a data infrastructure to support business needs
Work with data providers to establish data transfer process (set template, frequency and logistics)
Independently take responsibility for certain clients / projects in discussion with your line manager

Essential skills, knowledge and experience:
4-5 years related work experience in the field of data management, marketing analytics, and technology
Team management and supervisor experience
Strong skills in SQL and proven experience working with at least one of the major databases platforms (SQLServer, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, Sybase, or Postgres)
Working knowledge of data integration and manipulation in Python or R
Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focused way of working

Desirable skills, knowledge and experience:
Bachelors in Computer Science or related technical field
Experience with the full development life cycle of an application stack - from architecture through test and deployment
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations
Familiarity with big-data concepts, open-source tools, and optimization techniques
Proficient in system architectures (translating application design to operational requirements)
Experience in managing data-driven platform projects
Process-driven project management and multiple projects management experience
Prior knowledge of advertising ecosystem, understanding of marketing metrics, and analytical products offered as a service
Experience with key BI/data visualization tools such as Alteryx and Tableau
Cloud computing experience and data infrastructure management in the AWS stack
Client facing experience

Who are Gain Theory?

Gain Theory is a global marketing effectiveness consultancy that helps marketing and insight professionals have the confidence to make faster, smarter business decisions. It brings together data, technology and advanced analytical solutions delivered with a high touch consultancy approach.

As an independent practice within WPP, Gain Theory is passionate about making a meaningful difference to business performance – to improve marketing efficiency, grow market share and see baseline profits and share price growth.

The global team consists of 200+ consultants, data scientists, modelers, analysts and martech specialists who operate from three core regional hubs - New York, London, Singapore – serving 113 markets worldwide.

Job Description:
Who we are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

What you will be doing

With the support of a senior consultant, you will have the opportunity to carry out various projects independently and in collaboration with Artefact’s teams of experts: Strategy, Activation, Analytics, Data, Creation.
At the agency or at the client’s premises, the consultant is a true project manager. The diversity of your missions will allow you to be as close as possible to customer issues, to acquire a real knowledge of data and to quickly develop your skills.

Your missions will include:
define the needs of its customers by conducting interviews with customer teams and multiple technology partners,
to help build, formulate and present strategic data recommendations for the client,
to organize and conduct workshops and training to ensure the success of its projects,
to develop and present data recommendations to clients,
to imagine and present new support proposals to convince our future customers,
to participate in training courses to acquire the technical knowledge necessary for its mission as an advisor and to keep abreast of the latest technological innovations on the market,
and finally to participate in the writing of content on transversal subjects (e.g. publication of research works, writing articles or business cases).

What we are looking for

Graduated from a business school (desired), the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.

A first knowledge of digital marketing (within a start-up, agency, etc.) or consulting (Strategy, Management, IS), will obviously be valued.

Why you should join us

Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing
Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Come join us!

Job Title: Big Data Engineer (Data Security Implementation and Design)
Job Description:
As a Big Data Engineer within the Data Platform and Management team in Group IT, you will be establishing, developing, expanding and optimizing the data control architecture, design and implementation.

Your role includes:
Design, develop and implement data security, privacy, protection and associated control technology solutions as per best industry practice
Evaluate and renew implemented data security, privacy, overall data control solutions to ensure their relevancy and effectiveness in supporting business needs and regulatory requirement (PDPA, GDPR, Telecom act and etc.)
Drive development, optimization, testing and tooling to improve overall data control management (Security, Consent Management, Privacy, protection)
Review, analyze, benchmark and approve solution design from product companies, internal teams and vendors.
Ensure that proposed solutions are aligned and conformed to the data landscape, big data architecture guidelines and roadmap.

Responsibilities

Design and implement data security, privacy, protection framework and optimize service and access management
Understand business requirement and solution design to develop and implement solutions that adhere to big data architectural guidelines, address regulatory and compliance requirements
Design, develop and maintain data security and privacy framework, policy, solution and systems
Design, develop and maintain data protection and consent management systems
Drive BAU process, testing and tooling to improve data security, privacy and protection
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, control and optimizing data technology service delivery
Build robust and scalable data infrastructure to support needs from internal and external users, regulators and compliance requirement
Review and approve high level & detailed design to ensure that the solution delivers to the business needs and align to the data landscape and analytics, architecture principles and roadmap.
Understand and solution latest data security standards and tools to apply and adhere to the required data controls for user access in Cloudera/Hadoop, Oracle and other DB platform and overall data environment and projects
Support and contribute to development guidelines and standards for data security, privacy with Risk, Compliance, Regulatory functions
Work with infrastructure, operations, data scientist and business analytics team to assist in data related technical issues and implement effective solutions.

The ideal candidate should possess

Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data/Business Analytics or equivalent with 10-12 years of experience in data warehousing / Big Data/Hadoop / RDBMS – Security, Privacy, Protection technologies and tools
Expert in building data management solutions - data security, privacy solutions, architectures and Implementation
Ability to troubleshoot and issue resolution complex security, privacy requirement
Experience on structured and unstructured data design / modelling, data access, security and data storage techniques
Experience with relational SQL and NOSQL DB
Experience to do cost estimation based on the design and development
Experience with Agile, DevOps tools and environment
Hadoop / Big Data platform and it’s components knowledge and experience
Informatica data management tools (EDC, AXON, Secure@source, IDQ, BDQ), IBM Guardium Data Protection or equivalent
Data encryption, security management techniques and methodology
Dynamic Data Masking – Informatica Suite, Protegrity, Oracle/Teradata Dynamic Masking or equivalent.
Key Management Tech stack – AWS KMS, Thales and etc.
Micro-services – API, good to have API management tool Experience – Mulesoft, Apigee and etc.
Highly organized, self-motivated, pro-active, and able to plan
Ability to analyze and understand complex problems and translating into business terms
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong in User Requirements Gathering, Maintenance and Support
Managing operation, user expectation and vendors

Pioneer in driverless mobility, EasyMile revolutionizes passenger and goods transportation.

For the past 4 years, EasyMile has developed and deployed autonomous mobility solutions worldwide based on vehicles manufactured by recognized industrial partners. EasyMile’s clients include the world’s largest transport operators, city authorities, airports, corporations, business parks, and universities.

EasyMile supplies smart mobility solutions and autonomous technologies powering driverless vehicles with existing products such as: the EZ10, a 100% electric driverless shuttle deployed in 20 countries worldwide; the TractEasy, the first autonomous electric baggage tractor jointly developed with TLD; and many other projects to be unveiled soon.

EasyMile’s team is composed by more than 160 high skilled and passionate employees specializing in robotics, computer vision and vehicle dynamics.
The company has it own headquarter in Toulouse (France) and regional offices in Singapore (Asia), Denver (USA), Berlin (Germany) and Adelaide (Australia).

DISCOVER EASYMILE
Job description

We are looking for highly motivated people to build the road ahead and invent solutions to challenges never met before.

Beyond excellent technical skills, we are looking for the right attitude: ambition, creativity and perseverance.

Highlighting strong values such as innovation, excellence and team spirit, EasyMile’s team keeps pushing boundaries to invent the future of mobility.

Your future responsibilities :
Shape EasyMile’s data platform by ingesting, manipulating, and visualization data across on-premise data platforms
Leverage the best tools to define processes and workflows.
Ensuring that data is ingested and analysed securely and efficiently
Define, Implement and maintain pipelines / workflows for training, validation, and optimization of machine learning based algorithms
Develop, construct, optimize and maintain machine learning based infrastructure(s) (e.g. databases / data lakes, training server(s))
Employ sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods to prepare data for use in predictive and prescriptive modeling
Collaborate with cross functional agile teams of software engineers, data scientists, and others.
Preferred experience

There is no typical profile at EasyMile, we all come from different backgrounds and that is what makes us strong!

Don’t hesitate to apply if you are motivated and interested by innovative transportation and technologies .

We are looking for:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field
Experience as a Data Engineer, Software Developer, or similar.

Experience with Machine Learning toolkits like Tensorflow

Demonstrable aptitude in Python development
Experience working with cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, GCP)
Experience in data processing / ETL implementation (e.g. Beam, Airflow, Dataflow, Spark)
Experience with building data lakes and data warehouses
Good knowledge of writing performant SQL, Airflow, DataFlow and Spark
Containers technology including Docker and Kubernetes
Experience with real-time stream-processing systems (e.g. Kafka)
Very good oral and written English.

Strongly desirable

Experience with Tensorflow and KubeFlow
Experience with AI algorithm design
Experience in the automotive industry

Lead, Data & Insights

Job Description

We are looking for a superstar candidate to help build and deliver a strategy and roadmap for making us a data-driven enterprise, driving enterprise-wide governance and utilization of information as an asset.

In this role, you will champion data usage, management, insights, governance and quality with a team of data analysts and data scientists.

Drive overall data strategy

Data Analytics: Combine and curate large amounts of transactional data and convert it to usable dashboards for different business units

As Singtel GE embarks on an exciting Digital Transformation journey, we aim to gather more insights on how we can better serve our customers, build better customer experiences and identify new market segments we can grow our revenue with. This role of a Data Engineer is aimed at building internal capabilities to augment our reliance on external vendors in the ideation, creation and maintenance of data infrastructure and integration. Our existing projects span across artificial intelligence, machine learning and NLP.

Responsibilities

Dive into Singtel GE internal and third party data systems (think Mulesoft, Cloudera, Kubernetes) to make strategic recommendations on how best to architect our tech stack (e.g., personalized user flows, segmented marketing audiences, more accurate recommendations, churn prediction, propensity models).
Serve as a subject matter expert to other non-data engineers across the company as an available resource for all things related to data systems.
Develop and analyse best practices to leverage our Group data lake for MVPs around propensity modeling, user segmentation, text analytics, video analytics, churn prediction, personalisation/recommendation
Tell stories that describe data governance, capabilities and potential in meetings of all sizes with diverse audiences
Provide data-based thought leadership across a variety of technical and non-technical audiences to ensure that all levels of GE make data-driven decisions.

The ideal candidate should possess

Degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Statistics, or Industrial Engineering with 4 years of experience involving data systems, quantitative data analysis and complex problem solving.
Complete command of SQL, and either Python, R, or Hadoop frameworks along with some experience with Tableau. Proficiency with similar BI and visualization tools is also transferable.
Extensive experience directly querying large data sets including networks data, customer usage data, third party data and raw data ingested from non-standard platforms.
Strong written, verbal, and visual communication skills to concisely communicate in a way that provides context, offers insights, and minimizes misinterpretation.
The skills to work cross-functionally and push business partners to focus on realistic goals and projects.
Experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (think Hive, Pig, Presto, Spark)
Experience building and deploying analytic solutions as well as machine learning and/or optimization models in production.
Solid statistical knowledge and analytic thinking, ideally utilized in modelling and experimentation.

We are currently seeking candidates to fill a Medical Scientist role.

You will have the scope and capability to contribute to the development of our organisation’s medical quality improvement programs. The purpose of the role is to facilitate the translation of research data and quality improvement programs into clinical practice and improvement of patient care. The duties include assisting with drafting and reviewing documentation and publications, project coordination and liaison with project teams, as well as presentation to external stakeholders and conference participation.

This is a fantastic opportunity to become involved in medical management and quality improvement projects with an internationally recognised research organisation involved in the analysis and dissemination of real-life research from large-scale observational studies and pragmatic randomised controlled trials.

This role can be based in our UK (Cambridge or Norfolk), Singapore or Brisbane offices on a full or part time basis. For highly experienced individuals international remote working will be considered.

Primary responsibilities
To contribute to medical quality improvement programs
To continually assess the benefit of our quality improvement programs to patients, and tailor the programs to maximise their real-life application in a clinical setting
Review and contribute to scientific documents and publications (including proposals and reports)
To independently develop ethics applications for projects
To contribute to new and existing projects with respect to considering practical medical issues and clinical application; and to understand EMR data and coding systems and give guidance on the application of data to projects
Review and complete presentations, abstracts, and posters
Communication and liaison with internal team across various global locations
Liaison with study sponsors and steering committee experts
Presentations and calls with external stakeholders
Participation and presentations at international medical / scientific conferences
Qualifications
Clinical background required, ideally a qualified medic. A post-graduate degree in Biological Sciences or respiratory nursing background would also be considered
Minimum of 3 years of clinical experience required
Clinical experience or scientific study in the field of respiratory medicine is an advantage
Experience and Key Skills
Medical training and clinical background, with an interest in research and scientific studies
Experience of health research projects
Experience in scientific writing, publication of peer-review journal publications preferred
Client relations, liaising with external parties internationally, strong leadership and presentation skills
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
About Observational Pragmatic Research Institute (OPRI)

At OPRI we focus on improving disease management and patient outcomes by undertaking the highest quality observational and pragmatic clinical research. Working here means being ambitious, thinking big and working together to make a difference. By collaborating with world-renowned clinical, academic and industry partners OPRI has published over 200 papers and is considered a dynamic and progressive company at the forefront of advances in global healthcare.

Further information is available at www.opri.sg.

Immediate start is available.

Design, develop and support data warehouses, dashboards, and reporting tools
Work with other data engineers and stakeholders to design and spec ETL pipelines that are accurate, timely and suitable for downstream use cases

Identify and recommend different ways to constantly improve data reliability and quality.
Implement data access and security to allow data scientists and analysts to access data easily

3+ years of coding experience in Java and Python

Experience in designing data models and data warehouse
Experience in SQL and NoSQL database management systems
Experience in Apache Nifi, Apache Spark and Apache Kafka

Deep understanding of databases and engineering best practices - include handling and logging errors, monitoring the system, building human-fault-tolerant pipelines, understanding how to scale up, addressing continuous integration, knowledge of database administration, maintaining data cleaning and ensuring a deterministic pipeline

Purpose of job:
Support the DT team in using data analytics to track and monitor the effectiveness of COVID-19 recovery efforts; and develop statistical models that enables dynamic analysis across data sources for use by STB and its stakeholders.

Main Responsibilities:
Use data analytics to track and monitor the effectiveness of our COVID-19 recovery efforts. Examples include extracting data and developing dashboards related to tracking of performances at key visitor touchpoints / POIs. Data sources are such as:
i. unstructured data sources (e.g. social media) for tracking of visitor sentiments at key POIs
ii. data collection from partners' touchpoints to track the effectiveness of STB’s initiatives on COVID-19 recovery
iii. other real-time data streams from industry partners to build a meta-dataset with an intent of achieving an unprecedented level of insight on visitors' behaviour and needs in terms of scale and granularity
Develop statistical models to integrate and enable dynamic analysis across different real time data sources for use by STB and stakeholders
Apply data mining techniques, perform statistical analysis and prototype iterative analysis pipelines to provide insights at scale for specific use cases of core tourism industries. Integrate and implement these models into Stan for Tourism Industry to allow tourism industry stakeholders (e.g. attractions, hotels, F&B establishments, event organisers) to have a better sensing of forward performance and help guide their pricing strategies or resource planning.
Access the effectiveness and accuracy of these new data sources and data gathering techniques.

Requirements:
Experience in data modelling, creating, editing and publishing dashboards using visualisation tools such as QlikSense, Tableau
Experience in handling analytics tools (e.g. R)
Minimum 3 years relevant experience in data analytics role
Proven track record in engaging relevant stakeholders (within and outside of the organisation)
Strong analytical skills with an eye for details and possess an aptitude/experience in solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Ability to integrate and synthesise research and data across multiple sources to derive meaningful conclusions
Ability to communicate clearly complex data/concepts and outcomes of analysis so that learnings can be translated into strategies
Strong organisation and project management skills
Able to work in a fast-paced environment
Data sets management, involving meta data, data quality, data integration

Additional Information:
Contract role for 11 months

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Title: Senior Big Data Engineer (AWS, Spark, SQL)
Job Description:
Conceptualise, Implement and Maintain Big Data Pipelines (Batch and Real-Time Processing) and Cloud Infrastructure in AWS Environments to be able to process our evergrowing set of retail data.
Make excellent use of Technologies like Spark, Lambda, SQL, Python, S3 and Redshift or other Technologies to deploy stable and scalable Data Pipelines
Deploy Machine Learning Models in collaboration with in–house Data Scientists using AWS Technologies and Open Source Software.
Find novel solutions to complex data pipeline challenges together with our team of Product Managers and Software Engineers.
Building a great company and products together which disrupt the way how retailers and brands work together on Big Data.
7 +years of hand-on experience in Data Engineering, Big Data Pipelines, AWS Cloud Technologies, Redshift and Spark.
Excellent knowledge in SQL, ETL procedure, relational data models.
Willing to work in a dynamic and fast-paced start up environment with talentend data-passionate people.
Eager to work both conceptually on architecure and hands-on in implementation of new solutions together with the data engineering team
Basic conceptual understanding on Machine Learning Models and their deployment.
Experience in SQL Server and SSIS a plus.
Work experience in SaaS Startup Environment and or Retail Data is a plus.
Responsible and accurate work ethics
Fluent in english

Job Title: Analytics Consultant - Growth Segments - Public Health Data Science
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
Support investigation of new data assets and partnerships which enrich IQVIA’s offerings to growing segments of the client base in Southeast Asia in government, public health, and financial
institutions, payer provider, consumer health, and medtech.
Leveraging experience and familiarity with existing IQVIA data offerings including Global Markets Insights and Analytics Center of Excellence solutions to use as a starting point for generating
novel uses of existing data with new partners.
Building new tools and datasets to improve monitoring of health outcomes through collaborations with existing data partners, that possess diagnostics data, clinical data and national health systems data.
Support existing Services and Growth Segments team, aimed to work with these existing data partners to generate future pipeline of opportunities and plans to further expand efforts on these
partnerships.
Investigating the potential for new data assets to inform healthcare decision making
Conducting primary and secondary research, and performing quantitative and qualitative analyses to develop insights
Working independently and as part of a team, with some responsibility for managing and developing the career and skills of junior staff
Developing broad knowledge of related consulting methodologies and public health context through the delivery of consulting engagements and participation in formal and informal learning opportunities
Engaging in knowledge management to document projects and support standardization of processes. Familiarity with global health, including key issues, stakeholders and current developments
Experience with data in healthcare industry and/or public health (e.g. healthcare financing, healthcare economics or pharmaceuticals access)

Adaptability and an ability to learn quickly and apply new knowledge in technical fields
Excellent interpersonal and project management skills to work effectively with others in and across a large matrix organization to accomplish team goals
Proven analytical, interpretative and problem-solving skills

Well-developed written and verbal communication skills including story-boarding for powerpoint presentations, facilitating meetings and workshops, and report writing

Job Title: #SGunitedJobs Contract Data Analyst, Data Transformation & Data Science
Job Description:
Purpose of job:
Support the existing team in the development of advanced analytics models for tracking of performance, bring scientific rigour and enhance statistical methods to identify opportunities that will drive new business initiatives and growth.

Main Responsibilities:
Develop predictive models using machine learning algorithms for key KPIs such as visitor arrivals, tourism expenditure.
Create machine learning-based tools or processes (e.g. recommendation engines, and tracking of performance through A/B testing, and predictive capabilities) to assist in improving visitor engagement and satisfaction on STB's myriad touchpoints. Besides delivering on our long-term goal for the One SG vision, in the nearer term, this deliverable will also have the capabilities to provide stakeholders with a sensing on the industry performance / outlook post-COVID-19 by empowering them with insights on the visitors’ to facilitate their business recovery efforts.
Explore the use of Artificial Intelligence, deep learning, neural networks and/or new machine learning techniques to automate processes and further improve on model performance.
Advise industry stakeholders and the appointed vendor for Stan for Tourism Industry on the integration of new data where relevant and/or the building of new numerical models for future usability and analysis.

Requirements :
Experience in machine learning techniques and Artificial Intelligence Framework ecosystems e.g. k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, TensorFlow, etc.
At least 5 years of relevant experiences
Working experience for structured and unstructured datasets is essential
Possess extensive working experience solving analytical problems, including expertise in statistical data analysis such as linear models, regression, multivariate analysis, stochastic models and sampling methods.
Proficient in statistical programming tools (e.g. R, Python), database languages (e.g. SQL, Java).
Data sets management, involving meta data, data quality, data integration

Additional Information:
Contract role for 11 months

Disney+ Hotstar is leading the way as the largest and smartest video platform in the country, reaching over 300 million users today. We have set a number of world records along the way - including for the highest concurrent viewership at 25.3 million during the ICC Cricket World Cup 2019. Disney+ Hotstar today is the one-stop destination for all your entertainment needs - from Live Sports, Indian and International Shows and Movies to all Disney content, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Disney+ Originals. We’re looking for the brightest minds to build the future of TV with us.

About the Team

We are looking for smart and data-driven analysts to join our product team and help drive the growth and success of the product. The individual will need to have deep technical skills to complement their analytical experience The ideal candidate will be scrappy, independent, action-oriented and excited about building data insights to influence product priorities.

The pace of our growth is incredible – if you want to tackle hard and interesting problems at scale, and create an impact within an entrepreneurial environment, join us!

Your Key Responsibilities

Use data to inform and influence the direction of the product team roadmaps to inform business decisions
Partner with product teams to define goals and identify key metrics for existing features and new releases
Build automated dashboards and reports to drive awareness and understanding of key metrics and experiment results

What to Bring

Bachelor’s or Master’s in computer science or related discipline
A proven track record of using data to impact key business or product decisions
The ability to clearly and effectively communicate the results of complex analyses
Minimum of 3 years experience writing production datasets in SQL/Hive OR building internal/production data tools for ETL, experimentation, OR exploration in a scripting language (Python, PHP, Ruby, etc.)
A solid grasp of common statistical applications and methods
High adaptability in a dynamic start-up environment.

Our Values

Audacity
Self-Awareness
Ownership
Bias for Action
Collaboration
Radical Candour
Inclusivity
Mentorship

Who we are as an employer

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

Who we are as a company

We’re Disney+ Hotstar. The go-to destination for over 300 million users for everything from Live Sports, Indian and International Shows and Movies to all Disney content, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Disney+ originals. Our mission is to revolutionize internet entertainment through smart personalization, and by building a global video platform that takes over the world wide web and the whole wide world.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Job Brief Description

We are looking for a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to help us create artificial intelligence products. Your ultimate goal will be to shape and build efficient self-learning applications

Responsibilities

Designing and developing machine learning and deep learning systems

Running machine learning tests and experiments

Implementing appropriate ML algorithms

Creating machine learning models and retraining systems. To do this job successfully, you need exceptional skills in statistics and programming.

Knowledge of data science and software engineering

Study and transform data science prototypes

Design machine learning systems

Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools

Develop machine learning applications according to requirements

Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods

Run machine learning tests and experiments

Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results

Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks

Keep abreast of developments in the field

Develop process and tools to monitor and analyse ML model performance and data accuracy

Requirements

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role

Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture

Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms

Expertise in visualizing and manipulating big datasets

Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R, etc

Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)

Excellent communication skills

Ability to work in a team

Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills

BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or Electrical & Electronic Engineering (a plus); Master’s degree is an added advantage

The Data Analyst identifies and specifies data requirements for new reports to meet reporting needs of business users. He/She collects data from a multiple data sources such as website, social media platforms, mobile platforms and videos. He/She validates data from various sources and ensures readiness for analysis. He/She transforms data into the right data set before analysis. He/She assists in the qualitative/quantitative analysis of data and generates reports of analysis. He/She works with the relevant business stakeholders to develop recommendations to support the use case.

Responsibilities:
Enable the Corporate business leaders to get better visibility and insight into their business and activities through gathering of business requirements and building out tools (e.g., productivity tracking, KPI tracking, business management reports)
Analyze and develop deep insights on business performance, core performance metrics and support in preparation of weekly / monthly business reviews
Consolidate and escalate sales feedback on processes, tools and products
Ability to work independently to structure initiatives or business programs e.g., performance improvement programs
Share best practices with other regional / global Sales Operations teams
Connect the dots and drive engagement with key x-functional partners (e.g., Finance, Marketing, HR) to ensure alignment and movement towards a set of shared goals
Shape and lead initiatives that permanently up-level the Corporate and ECD teams capabilities, their effectiveness AND simplify their lives

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience working in an Enterprise Software/SaaS sales organization
3-5 years of experience in management consulting, corporate strategy, or equivalent project management experience in a technology/media company
Distinctive problem solving, analytical, presentation and communication skills
Strong, demonstrable experience of leading large programs and/ or consulting projects at a consulting firm and preferably in an Enterprise sales space
Ability to be flexible in a fast paced environment with limited direction, balance competing priorities, and manage several time-sensitive projects at once

Technical Capabilities:
GoogleSQL: Ability to write complex sql statements
Tableau
PLX Dashboards
Excel / GSuite - Sheets
Salesforce

Attain Analytics Group is looking for highly analytical, self-motivated Consultants with strong background in Office of Finance solutions, understanding or knowledge of finance, lease accounting or insurance contracts, core finance reporting and performance management processes (budgeting & planning, forecasting and consolidation) to implement Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance Management and Predictive Analytics platform for our customers. Our Customers include growing SMEs, MNCs and Public Sector organisations.

You will have opportunity to work alongside with more experienced project team members and architect multi-dimensional data models, create actionable reports, dashboards, planning and budgets templates to drive data-driven decision making culture for our customers. Your functional or technical expertise and business acumen will be essential to nurture customers, drive platform adoption and repeat purchases.

You work with a team, driving Planning, Reporting and Analytics transformation in the Office of Finance with CFOs to provide stewardship in their organizations.
You implement Management Dashboards, Planning, Budgeting, Reporting and Consolidation applications through Enterprise Performance Management Platform
You will have opportunity to work on projects that can range from proof of concept to full scope implementations
You ask questions, determine requirements and needs of the customer
You design and develop application, taking performance, reporting, workflow, other considerations of customers and turning them into actionable tasks for project delivery.
You develop application training guide and train customer to ensure project handover and success.
You will also be required to carry out Pre-sales product demonstration and provide event or trade show support
You will be provided with the necessary training to be enabled on the software that we use.

Requirements:
Degree in Accountancy or Business Analytics
Good knowledge of MS Excel, Word and Powerpoint
Strong skills in critical thinking, decision making, problem solving, and attention to detail in executing project task
Excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills personable, credible and engaging
Able to work against very tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in executing project to achieve on-time, on-budget implementations

Job Title: Data Analyst â€“ New Cost Allocation

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities

The Role

The Senior Analytics Manager will play a key role in maintaining a portfolio of Analytics 360 clients, either directly, or working as a technical/strategic lead on the accounts.

This involves ensuring the quality of deliverables are at a high standard (be it through your own personal work or via one of the team globally), actively participating in meetings / presentations with your respected clients and maintaining the overall success and profitability of your particular accounts.

You will liaise very closely with a Strategic Director & Technical Director to ensure the portfolio of accounts you control have a strategic roadmap and that deliverables are using best practice. You are responsible for the success of your respective clients.

You will identify commercial opportunities and work alongside Directors and Heads to develop and implement innovation that will benefit the entire global team.

You will also be mentoring Analytics Managers, Analytics Executives and Associates, from both a strategic and technical point of view, to ensure they’re learning and helping us achieve our global goals.

Responsibilities

Present to internal and external stakeholders client progress.
Ensure that your portfolio of accounts have a strategic and technical roadmap to determine success.
Provide support and mentorship for other members of the team, ensuring they are progressively able to take on more complex tasks and upskill others.
Actively monitor the happiness of a portfolio of clients via external surveys.
Compose case studies that are distributed on the Jellyfish website and / or via Google.
Increase knowledge in Google stack by being on top of Google Analytics 360 Suite, Doubleclick & AdWords new certifications, and examinations.
Drive performance of analytics capabilities to impact overall business results while keeping costs in check and ensuring the team remains within the planned budget.
Work collaboratively with all teams to ensure resources are effectively shared and overall Analytics & Optimisation team utilization & revenue targets are met.
Ensure client satisfaction and optimal NPS scores for respective Analytics clients
Take accountability of business targets and focus on GA360 client acquisition and retention.
Find opportunities for the business to cross-sell other services (especially those running off the Google stack), including conversion optimization, attribution, etc.
Work closely with the Technical Director to ensure tasks are being conducted via best practice.
Work closely with the Strategic Director to formulate a client roadmap and gauge profitability.
Deliver all projects (including those of the team) on time and on budget, and is able to keep track of project progress, raise alarm, etc. when either may not be achieved.
Keep accurate logging of time to ensure clients are billed consistently.
Provide input into relevant product offering so it’s kept up-to-date and reflects our position as a market leading analytics provider.
Work closely with Directors and Heads to establish specialisms goals and strategies, defining processes and frameworks.

Knowledge & Experience Requirements

Experience within the digital marketing industry, preferably agency-side.
Possess proven experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL. Exposure to Python/R or other scripting languages highly desired.
Highly experienced working with analytics solutions, ranging from auditing, implementations, data analysis & insights, presenting to large audiences and training.
Strong experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, both web and apps, is a must.
Has a fluent understanding of Google Analytics 360 Suite, the key benefits and how to leverage the Google stack to the greatest advantage of clients.
Has expert knowledge of the Google integrations with products including (but not limited to) Doubleclick & Big Query.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to lead.
Working knowledge of data visualisation products, including Data Studio.
Strong understanding of Display, PPC and SEO marketing channels preferred.
Experience managing a team preferred.
Demonstrate outstanding capabilities in data manipulation, cleansing, interrogation, and interpretation.
Deliver projects to tight timescales.
Results focused, with good communication and interpersonal skills and attention to detail.
Can clearly communicate processes, strategies and general requirements to both internal and external stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify business questions, analyse data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations.

Key Attributes

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Confident at presenting to key stakeholders and large groups of people.
Flexible, versatile and copes well under pressure.
Proactive, passionate about data and willing to learn the latest functionality.
Is a key team member who sets an example to colleagues.
A motivated individual with high levels of energy.
A positive thinker, with consistent levels of evident enthusiasm.
Open, honest and direct, is comfortable in giving and receiving constructive feedback.
Confident in guiding other individuals and working within teams.
Organised and able to manage your own workloads and direct others
